query_variations: How do I create a new account?

What details are needed for registration?
I don't have an account yet
Steps to make a new profile
answer: To create a new account, go to the Sign Up form. You must fill in the following required fields: First Name, Last Name, a valid Email Address, Organization Name (to link your account), Password, and Confirm Password. Once all fields are filled, click the 'Sign Up' button.

query_variations: What is the Organization Name field for?
Why do I need to enter an organization name?
What should I put in Organization Name?
answer: The Organization Name is a mandatory field during Sign Up. You must enter the name of your organization to correctly link your new account to a specific organization within the platform.

query_variations: How do I request a password reset?
Where is the forgot password button?
I can't remember my login details
Send me a password reset link
answer: If you forgot your password: 1. Click the 'Forgot Password?' button on the login screen. 2. Enter the Email Address registered with your account. 3. Click the 'Submit' button. You will receive a reset link in your email inbox.

query_variations: How do I use the reset password link?
What do I do after receiving the reset email?
Steps to set a new password
I got the email, how do I change the password?
answer: Open the password reset email sent to your inbox and follow these steps: 1. Click the 'Reset Password' button/link in the email. 2. In the browser window that opens, enter your New Password in the first field. 3. Re-enter the password in the Confirm Password field (they must match). 4. Click 'Submit' to replace your old password with the new one.

query_variations: Why is my password not being accepted?
What is considered a strong password?
Does the password need special characters?
Can I use a simple password?
answer: The system requires a strong password for security. It must contain a minimum of 8 characters and include at least: one uppercase letter (A-Z), one lowercase letter (a-z), one digit (0-9), and one special character (e.g., !, @, #).

query_variations: How long is the reset link valid?
Does the password reset link expire?
Why does the link say expired?
answer: The password reset link sent to your email will expire in exactly one hour. If you do not click the link and reset your password within this time, you must request a new one via the 'Forgot Password' page.

query_variations: Can I use any email address?
answer: You must provide a valid email address during Sign Up. This email is used to identify your account during Sign In and is necessary for sending account-related notifications, such as password reset links.

query_variations: How do I access my profile?
I want to see my personal settings
Where can I find the My Profile section?
Where is the profile picture button?
answer: To access your profile, click your profile picture located in the top-right corner of the screen. In the dropdown menu that appears, hover over 'My Profile' to see options like Personal, Policies, and Payslips.

query_variations: What information is on my profile page?
How do I check my joining date?
Where can I see my employee ID?
Where is my date of birth listed?
answer: Navigate to 'My Profile' -> 'Personal'. This page displays your Basic Information (Joining Date, DOB, Email, Phone, Blood Group, Gender, National ID), Employment Status (Job Type, Active Status, Designation), and Assigned Locations.

query_variations: How do I edit my profile?
I want to change my phone number
Can I update my profile picture?
How to correct my name spelling?
answer: To make changes, go to 'My Profile' -> 'Personal' and click the 'Edit Profile' button in the top right corner. In the 'Basic Information' section, you can update your First Name, Last Name, Phone Number, Date of Birth, Blood Group, Marital Status, Gender, and upload a new Profile Photo.

query_variations: How do I add an emergency contact?
Where do I put my father's contact info?
answer: In the 'Edit Profile' form, scroll down to the 'Emergency Contact' section. You must fill in the Full Name, Relation (e.g., Father, Spouse), National ID, and Phone Number of your contact person. This ensures the company knows who to call in an emergency.

query_variations: I moved house, how do I update my address?
My permanent address is the same as my current one
answer: In the 'Edit Profile' form, locate the 'Address' section. You can enter a Temporary Address and a Permanent Address. If both are the same, simply check the 'Same as Temporary Address' box to auto-fill the permanent address field.

query_variations: How do I update my bank account?
Where do I enter my IBAN?
answer: In the 'Edit Profile' menu, click on the 'Details' option (or scroll to the Bank Details section depending on view). You need to enter your Bank Name (e.g., HBL, Meezan), Branch Name, Account Title (your name as it appears in the bank), and your IBAN/Account Number. Accurate details are required for salary processing.

query_variations: How do I upload my resume?
Where can I see my uploaded documents?
answer: To manage files, go to the 'Documents' section in the 'Edit Profile' form. You can select a document type (Resume, Identity Card, Degree, etc.) and click 'Upload Document'. To view or download existing files, go to the main 'Personal' page and look at the Documents table at the bottom.

query_variations: How do I change my login password?
I want to change my terminal PIN
Set a new PIN for attendance
answer: To update security settings, open 'Edit Profile' and scroll to the 'Credentials' section. Here you can enter a 'New PIN' (4 digits for attendance terminals) or a 'New Password' for the portal. Remember to click 'Save & Exit' to apply the changes.

query_variations: Where can I read company policies?
How do I find the leave policy?
answer: To view company guidelines, click your profile picture and select 'Policies'. This page lists all policies applicable to you (like Leave Policy, WFH Policy). Click on a policy row to expand it and read the full summary or detailed information.

query_variations: How do I download my payslip?
Where can I see my salary slip?
answer: To access your salary statements, click your profile picture and select 'Payslips'. The page displays a list of monthly payslips. Find the relevant month and click 'Click To View Pay Slip' to open or download the PDF file.

query_variations: How do I save my profile edits?
What is the difference between Save & Next and Save & Exit?
Do I have to save before leaving the page?
answer: At the bottom of the Edit Profile form, use 'Save & Next' to save the current section and move to the next one. Use 'Save & Exit' to save all changes and close the form. Clicking 'Next' without saving may result in lost data.

query_variations: How do I access my rota?
I want to see my work calendar
Where are my shifts and requests?
answer: To access your schedule and requests, click on 'My Rota' in the side navigation bar. This section contains your Shifts, Attendance records, Requests, Leave Balance, and Reports.

query_variations: How do I check my shifts for next week?
What shift am I on tomorrow?
How to switch between weekly and monthly views?
answer: Go to 'My Rota' -> 'Shifts'. By default, it shows the Weekly View. Use the arrow keys at the top to navigate between weeks. To see the full month's schedule, click the 'Month' button in the top right corner. Each day block displays your assigned shift (e.g., Morning, Evening) or off days.

query_variations: How do I check my attendance record?
View my clock in and out history
See if I was late last week
answer: Navigate to 'My Rota' -> 'Attendance'. You can view records in 'Grid' or 'Table' format. Use the date arrows to switch months. The table displays the Date, Scheduled Time, Actual Clock In/Out times, Breaks, and Total Hours worked. Lateness or early exits are often highlighted.

query_variations: Where do I submit a new request?
How to check the status of my leave request?
See if my WFH was approved
answer: Go to 'My Rota' -> 'Requests'. Here you can view all your submitted requests. Use the filters at the top to search by Date Range, Request Type (Leaves, WFH, etc.), or Status (Pending, Approved, Declined). To submit a new one, click the '+ Add' button.

query_variations: How do I apply for annual leave?
What fields are needed for leave application?
answer: To apply for leave: 1. Go to 'Requests' -> '+ Add'. 2. Select the 'Leaves' tab. 3. Choose the 'Leave Type' (e.g., Annual, Sick). 4. Select 'Start Date' and 'End Date'. 5. Optionally add a Message or Attachment (like a medical note). 6. Click 'Submit'.

query_variations: How do I request a short leave?
I need to leave work for 2 hours
Can I take a half day?
answer: For short durations: 1. Click '+ Add' in Requests and select 'Short Leaves'. 2. Select 'Leave Type' and 'Leave Date'. 3. Select your specific 'Shift' for that day. 4. Enter the specific 'Start Time' and 'End Time' for your leave. 5. Click 'Submit'.

query_variations: How do I request to work from home?
Do I need a balance for WFH?
answer: To request WFH: 1. Click '+ Add' in Requests and select 'Work From Home'. 2. Enter the 'Start Date' and 'End Date'. 3. Provide a reason if required. 4. Click 'Submit'. Note: You must have an available WFH leave balance to submit this request.

query_variations: I forgot to clock in, what do I do?
answer: If you missed a punch: 1. Click '+ Add' in Requests and select 'Clock In/Clock Out Request'. 2. Select the 'Shift Date' and the specific 'Shift'. 3. Check 'Clock In Request' (if you missed start) or 'Clock Out Request' (if you missed end). 4. Enter a reason (e.g., 'System Error') and click 'Submit'.

query_variations: How do I request a shift change?
Request to move from morning to evening shift
answer: To change your shift: 1. Click '+ Add' in Requests and select 'Shift Changes'. 2. Select the 'Shift Date' you wish to change. 3. Enter a 'Reason for Shift Change' (Mandatory). 4. Click 'Submit'. This sends a request to your manager for approval.

query_variations: How many leaves do I have left?
answer: Go to 'My Rota' -> 'Leave Balance'. This section provides a consolidated view of your total allocated leaves, used leaves, and remaining balance for all categories (Annual, Sick, Casual, WFH, etc.).

query_variations: How do I create a new team in the system?
Where is the Add Team button?
answer: Navigate to 'EMS' -> 'Accountability'. Click the '+ Add Team' button. Enter the 'Team Name' in the text field and click 'Submit'. Once created, you can select this team from the dropdown menu to manage its activities.

query_variations: How do I create a new job title?
answer: In 'EMS' -> 'Accountability', look for the Designation section (or click 'Add Designation'). You must enter the 'Name' of the designation (e.g., Senior Developer). Optionally, you can add a description of 'Roles and Responsibilities' and immediately assign 'Users' to this designation using the dropdown. Click 'Save' to finish.

query_variations: How do I see who changed what in a team?
View audit logs for a team
answer: In 'EMS' -> 'Accountability', select a team and click the 'Activity' button. This opens a modal showing logs of actions (Created, Updated, Deleted). You can filter these logs by Employee, Event Type, or Date Range to track specific changes within the team.

query_variations: How do I add a new user to the system?
Send an invitation to a new hire
What fields are required to invite someone?
answer: Go to 'EMS' -> 'Employees' and click the '+ Invite' button. You must fill in the following mandatory fields: Employee Number, Joining Date, First Name, Last Name, and Email Address. Click 'Submit' to send the invitation email to the user.

query_variations: How do I check if an employee accepted the invite?
answer: In 'EMS' -> 'Employees', click the 'Invited Users' button. This displays a list of all sent invitations. You can search by name/email or use the 'Filter' dropdown to view invitations by status: Sent, Pending, Accepted, Declined, or Expired. This helps in tracking onboarding progress.

query_variations: Where is the master list of all employees?
How to search for an employee details?
answer: The main 'Employees' screen in EMS displays the directory of all users. You can use the search bar to find specific profiles. Clicking the 'Activity' button on this screen allows you to view system-wide user actions, filtered by employee or event type.

query_variations: How do I manage shifts and terminals?
answer: In EMS, **Rota Management** is the section used to manage Shifts, Attendance records, and Terminal devices. You can expand this menu to access specific sub-modules like 'Terminals' and 'Terminal Users' [cite: 1005-1009].

query_variations: How do I add a new attendance machine?
Where do I enter the terminal password?
answer: To add a device, go to **EMS** -> **Rota Management** -> **Terminals** and click **+ Add**. You must enter the **Name** (label), a secure **Password** for authentication, and optionally assign **Designations** (to restrict usage) and a **Location**. [cite_start]You can also **Copy**, **Edit**, or **Delete** existing terminals [cite: 1046-1074].

query_variations: How do I see who used a terminal?
View clock in history for a specific device
answer: In the **Terminals** section, click the **Activity** button. [cite_start]This opens a log of attendance actions performed on that specific device, allowing you to view which employees clocked in/out and when [cite: 1049-1051].

query_variations: How do I give an employee access to a terminal?
Assigning a PIN to a user
Registering a user for biometric attendance

You must enter the user's **Name**, create a 4-digit **Pin** (for authentication), and select which **Terminals** they are allowed to access from the dropdown list. [cite_start]Click **Submit** to save [cite: 1084-1100].

query_variations: How do I view all employee attendance?
Can I use AI to analyze attendance?

[cite: 1013-1036].

query_variations: How do I add a public holiday?
answer: Go to **EMS** -> **Public Events**. This shows a calendar view of the year. Click **+ Add Event** to create a new holiday or event by entering the name, date, description, and location. [cite_start]These events will be visible to all employees [cite: 1104-1121].

query_variations: How do I see who is working right now?
answer: Go to **EMS** -> **Reports**. **Live Attendance** shows real-time status including check-in times and locations. [cite_start]**Live Tracking** displays a 24-hour timeline bar for each employee, showing active work sessions in blue and the current time with a red dashed line [cite: 1126-1155].

query_variations: How do I generate a lateness report?
View total working hours for the month
answer: Navigate to **EMS** -> **Reports** -> **Time & Attendance**. You can select the report type: **Lateness** (shows total late entries) or **Working Hours** (shows total hours). [cite_start]You can group this data by **Date**, **Monthly**, or **Yearly** to analyze trends [cite: 1162-1183].

query_variations: Where do I approve employee requests?
How do I add a new user to the system?
answer: Go to **EMS** -> **Requests**. This is a centralized view for all employee requests (Leave, WFH, Shift Changes, etc.). [cite_start]You can filter by **Status** (Pending, In Process, Approved, Declined) or use the **For Approval** filter to see items requiring your immediate action [cite: 1184-1212].

query_variations: Where do I set up company rules?
What types of policies can I create?
answer: The **Policy Manager** in EMS is the central hub where you define and enforce organizational rules. You can create four specific types of policies: **Leaves** (allowances and rules), **Work From Home** (remote work quotas), **Change Shift** (rules for swapping shifts), and **Shift Policies** (timings, breaks, and overtime rules) [cite: 1224-1230].

query_variations: Can AI write the policy for me?
How do I use the AI Assistant for policies?
answer: Yes, the **AI Assistant** button is available in the policy sections. You can enter your requirements in plain text (e.g., '10 annual leaves with carry forward' or 'Overtime paid at 2% per hour'), and the AI will generate a complete policy draft for you to review and save. [cite_start]This feature is available for Leave and Shift policies [cite: 1232-1235, 1349-1352, 1408-1411, 1477-1480].

query_variations: How do I start a new leave policy?
Targeting specific users for leave rules
answer: To create a Leave Policy: 1. Go to **Policy Manager** -> **Leaves** -> **+ Add**. 2. **Step 1 (Details):** Enter the Policy Title, Start Date, End Date, and any Notes. 3. **Step 2 (Implement On):** Select the employees this applies to. [cite_start]You can select individual users or use **User Filters** to apply it to groups like 'Full-time' or 'Probation' staff [cite: 1236-1280].

query_variations: How do I set the total number of leaves?
answer: In **Step 3 (Leave Details)**, select the **Leave Type** (e.g., Annual). Then configure: 1. **Total Leave:** Number of days/hours allowed. 2. **Balance Type:** Choose 'Days' or 'Hours'. 3. **Sandwich Leaves:** Check boxes to count weekends/holidays as leave if they fall between taken leaves (e.g., 'Before and After Weekend'). 4. [cite_start]Options to **Allow Short Leave** or **Allow Unpaid Leave** [cite: 1287-1308].

query_variations: How do I deduct salary for unpaid leave?
Deduct percentage of salary for absence
answer: In **Step 4 (Deductions)**, you define financial penalties for the leave type. You can set a **Percentage per Hour/Day** (e.g., 10% of salary per day) or click **+ Add Deduction** to set a fixed **Amount per Hour/Day** (e.g., 500 PKR). [cite_start]Click **Save** to finalize the policy [cite: 1314-1332].

query_variations: How do I set WFH limits?
answer: Go to **Policy Manager** -> **Work From Home** -> **+ Add**. 1. **Step 1:** Enter the Policy Title, **Total WFH** quota (e.g., 5 Days), and the date range. 2. **Step 2:** Select the users or employment types (e.g., 'Full-time') this policy applies to. [cite_start]Click **Save** to activate [cite: 1345-1394].

query_variations: How do I limit shift swap requests?
Creating a policy for changing shifts
Set recurring dates for shift changes
Allow employees to request shift changes
answer: Go to **Policy Manager** -> **Change Shift** -> **+ Add**. 1. **Step 1:** Define the Title and **Total Change Shift Requests** allowed (e.g., 3). Set **Recurring Dates** (Weekly/Monthly) to determine when the quota resets. 2. **Step 2:** Assign the policy to specific users or groups via filters. [cite_start]Click **Save** [cite: 1404-1459].

query_variations: How do I create a standard work shift?
Assigning shift rules to a department
answer: Go to **Policy Manager** -> **Shift Policies** -> **+ Add**. 1. **Step 1:** Name the policy (e.g., '9-5 Standard'), set dates, and choose **Frequency** (Weekly/Monthly/Yearly) for auto-updates. 2. [cite_start]**Step 2:** Select the target Users or use filters to assign this shift structure to specific employee types [cite: 1472-1517].

query_variations: How do I set late arrival tolerance?
How do I configure early exit rules?
Defining break times and grace periods
How early can someone clock in?
answer: In **Step 3 (Policy Rules)**, you define the strictness of the shift: 1. **Late Clock-In Tolerance:** Minutes allowed before marking 'Late' (e.g., 10 mins). 2. **Early Clock-Out Tolerance:** Grace period for leaving early. 3. **Late Break:** Tolerance for returning from breaks. 4. [cite_start]**Early Clock-In Allowance:** How early the system accepts a punch before shift start [cite: 1518-1525].

query_variations: How do I set up overtime pay?
Setting deductions for missing shift rules
answer: In **Step 4 (Compensation)**, you define financial rules: 1. **Overtime Bonuses:** Set percentage per hour/minute or fixed amounts. 2. **Shift Bonuses:** Extra pay for completing shifts. 3. **Deductions:** Penalties for policy violations. [cite_start]You can define these as percentages of salary or fixed gross amounts [cite: 1526-1550].

query_variations: How do I set double pay for holidays?
Bonuses for working on Independence Day
answer: In **Step 5 (Public Events)**, you can select specific holidays (created in the Public Events module) and assign special **Bonus Percentages**. [cite_start]For example, setting 'Percentage per Day: 100%' would effectively pay double for working on that specific holiday [cite: 1551-1558].

query_variations: When was the shift policy updated?
answer: In any policy section (Leaves, WFH, Shifts), click the **Activity** button in the top right. This opens a log showing who created, updated, or deleted policies and the timestamps for those actions. [cite_start]You can filter these logs by date to track changes over time [cite: 1333-1335, 1460-1462].

The **Salary Management** module in EMS is used to structure and process employee compensation. It consists of two main sections: **Payrolls** (where you generate and disburse salaries) and **Salary Elements** (where you define components like Basic Pay, Allowances, and Deductions) [cite: 1560-1565].

query_variations: How do I create a new payroll?
answer: To create a payroll: 1. Go to **Salary Management** -> **Payrolls** -> **+ Add**. 2. Enter a **Payroll Name** (e.g., 'August Salary') and select the **Type** (e.g., Monthly). 3. Define the **Period** (Start Date, End Date) and the **Payment Date**. 4. Select **Users** (individually or via filters). 5. Check the boxes for the **Salary Elements** to include. 6. [cite_start]Click **Submit** to generate the draft [cite: 1572-1606].

query_variations: What is the difference between End Date and Payment Date?
Which date determines the salary calculation?
answer: When creating a payroll: **Start Date** and **End Date** define the period for which work days are calculated (e.g., Aug 1st to Aug 31st). The **Payment Date** is when the salary is actually disbursed to employees (e.g., Sept 5th). [cite_start]This allows flexibility if you pay in arrears [cite: 1583-1591].

query_variations: How do I finalize the payroll?
answer: After creating a payroll, it stays in **Unpublished** (draft) status. You can edit it or view details. To finalize it and make payslips available to employees, click the **Publish/Process** icon in the Actions column. [cite_start]Once published, it cannot be easily edited [cite: 1624-1632].

query_variations: How do I add a new allowance?
answer: Go to **Salary Management** -> **Salary Elements** -> **+ Add**. Select the type (**Allowance** or **Deduction**), enter a **Name** (e.g., House Rent), and write a description. You can set a fixed value or a **Formula**. [cite_start]Finally, choose the application frequency (e.g., Monthly, Apply to All) and click **Save** [cite: 1643-1669].

query_variations: How do I write a formula for salary?
Calculate allowance as percentage of basic
answer: In the **Formula** field of a Salary Element, you can define calculations. For example, to make an allowance worth 20% of the basic salary, you would enter: `Basic * 0.20`. For a deduction based on gross pay, you might use: `Gross - Tax`. [cite_start]This allows for dynamic payroll calculations [cite: 1655-1658].

query_variations: Can AI create payrolls for me?
How to use AI for salary elements?
answer: Yes, both Payrolls and Salary Elements sections have an **AI Assistant** button. [cite_start]You can type commands like 'Create a monthly payroll for August' or 'Create a Transport Allowance of 10% Basic Pay', and the system will auto-fill the forms for you to review [cite: 1568-1571, 1639-1642].

query_variations: When was the salary element deleted?
answer: Use the **Activity** button in either the Payrolls or Salary Elements section. [cite_start]This displays a log of actions including creation, updates, publishing, or deletion of salary records, along with the user who performed the action and the timestamp [cite: 1607-1610, 1670-1673].

query_variations: How do I check system usage?
Where can I see the number of active users?
answer: Go to the **Administrator** module and select **Admin Profile**. This screen displays key organization details, including the total count of **Active Users** and the current **Storage Usage** (file space used for documents/attachments) [cite: 1821-1831].

query_variations: How do I change the organization name?
answer: In the **Admin Profile** section, click the **Edit Profile** button. You can upload a **Profile Photo**, update the **Organization Name** (e.g., C2O), and change the **Email Address**. [cite_start]Click **Submit** to save these changes [cite: 1833-1842].

query_variations: Where can I find my invoices?
answer: Navigate to **Administrator** -> **Invoices**. [cite_start]Here you can manage billing by using the **Search Bar** (to find specific invoice numbers or customers) or filtering by **Date Range** (Start/End Date) and **Status** (Paid, Unpaid, Draft) [cite: 1844-1856].

query_variations: How do I manage user permissions?
answer: Go to **Preferences** -> **Permission's** (or Roles & Permissions). [cite_start]This is the central hub for defining user access, creating roles, and configuring what modules employees can see or edit [cite: 1858-1861, 1871-1872].

query_variations: How do I create a new user role?
Define a new job role in the system
Setting up a role tag color
answer: In the **Permission's** section, click the **+ Add Role** (or Add/New) button. You must enter a **Role Name** (e.g., Marketing, QA Engineer), select a **Role Tag Color** for visual identification, and optionally add a **Description**. query_variations: What is the difference between SEATS and ROLE?
answer: Roles are classified into two types: **ROLE** refers to core/system roles usually assigned to specific individuals, while **SEATS** refers to roles that can be assigned to multiple users at once (often based on license/seat count). [cite_start]You can filter the list by these types using the **Type Filter** dropdown [cite: 1918-1919, 1925-1929].

query_variations: How do I change what a role can do?
Update permissions for a specific role
answer: To modify access, locate the role in the list and use the **Actions** icons. Click **Update Permissions** to assign specific rights (view, edit, delete) for different modules. [cite_start]You can also click **Preview** to see all currently assigned permissions and users for that role [cite: 1933-1935].

query_variations: When was a new role created?
answer: Click the **Activity** button in the Permissions section. This displays a log of all role-related actions (Create, Update, Delete), including the **User** who performed the action and the **Timestamp**. [cite_start]You can filter these logs by employee or date range [cite: 1903-1914].

query_variations: What do I see when I log in?
Where is the main landing page?
answer: The Dashboard is the main landing page of SyntraFlow that appears immediately after login. query_variations: How do I check my performance?
Where can I see my tasks and goals?
What does the Q4 Overview mean?

How many WFH days do I have left?
View casual and sick leave balance
What is the donut chart on the dashboard?
answer: The 'My Leave Balance' widget uses a color-coded donut chart to show your available quotas for Annual, Casual, Sick, Work-From-Home (WFH), and Shift Changes. It displays the total allocated leaves versus leaves consumed (e.g., 'Casual: 2.25/10').

How do I view my attendance tab?

This helps you quickly visualize your punctuality and presence.

query_variations: How do I see my team's attendance on the dashboard?

If you manage multiple groups, use the **Team Selector** dropdown to switch views between different teams.

query_variations: Where can I see my pending requests?
answer: The Requests widget has two tabs: 1. **My Requests** (All Users): Shows your recent Leave, WFH, or Shift Change requests with their status (Pending, Approved). query_variations: Do I have any meetings today?
answer: The 'Today's Meetings' widget lists all meetings scheduled for the current day. Each entry shows the **Meeting Title**, **Time** (Start - End), and a **Join** button (or video icon) to quickly enter the meeting if it is online.

query_variations: Is there an event this month?
